Job Title: Senior Marketing Project Manager

Location: Florida, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Advertising, Project Management

Description:
Why join Mad?
Joining Mad means you’ll be joining a team of creatives who treat every workday as an opportunity to learn and grow. We have a thriving in-person and vibrant virtual culture. We encourage collaboration, curiosity, and passion in order to make our clients stand out among their competitors. Our culture is positive, flexible, inclusive, and engaging. We treat our space as a playground where we encourage you to test any creative ideas you’ve been wanting to try but never had the opportunity to. Working at Mad means being empowered to bring your unique perspective into every project, client production, the community - and the industry at large.
What will you be doing?
Sr. Marketing Project Managers are crucial in planning and overseeing projects to ensure they are executed efficiently and align with the company's strategic objectives. They coordinate resources, establish project timelines, manage budgets, monitor progress, and keep stakeholders informed throughout the project lifecycle. Their primary focus is delivering projects on time, within budget, and according to specified quality standards while adhering to the company's goals and vision. Marketing Project Managers are essential for various projects, including network infrastructure upgrades, phone hardware, system upgrades, and customer service initiatives. They work closely with cross-functional teams, including operations, marketing, and customer support to drive project success and deliver value to the organization and its customers.
Responsibilities:
Execute campaigns provided by strategy agency that align with the client's strategic objectives and timelines;Lead the execution of marketing programs from start to finish, leveraging the right internal processes;Work with the other marketing teams, other internal stakeholders, and external agencies and vendors;Be the lead leisian between the strategy agency’s Sr. Strategist, Data Analyst, and Mad creative production team;Develop and manage a team’s schedule forecasting for campaigns - and coordinate with Traffic Managers;Monitor campaign progress and identify potential risks or issues to keep projects on track;Communicate regularly with stakeholders to provide project updates, address concerns, and solicit feedback;Ensure adherence to best practices and quality standards throughout the project lifecycle;Facilitate collaboration among cross-functional teams to achieve project goals and deliverables;Conduct post-project retros to identify areas for improvement and best practices to apply to future projects;Evaluate the impact of marketing programs in achieving their stated objectives, including impact on retention;Measure project performance to identify areas for improvement.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in communications, computer science, business, or a related field;Several years of experience in project management, preferably within the telecom sector, with progressively increasing responsibilities;Strong attention to detail and excellent communication skills are essential for successful project managers in the telecom industry. They must effectively communicate project goals, expectations, and progress updates to stakeholders at all levels of the organization;Proficiency in project management software and tools is advantageous, as project managers often use specialized software to plan, track, and manage project tasks, resources, and schedules.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
